title: Characterization Package Specification
text: Summary data.frame counts often outcome occurred within time-period relative first target index date combination target outcome. counts stratified whether outcome first event subsequent timing category outcome occurred (first target exposure, first target exposure, subsequent target exposure, target exposures last target exposure).

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: consider inputs : Consider five patients; target cohort (dates five patients exposed drug) Table 1 outcome cohort (dates five patients outcome) Table 2. also illustrated Figures 1 2.
code: targetIds <- c(1) outcomeIds <- c(2)

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: Example time--event data dates. Example time--event data timing. rows outcome table, calculate time patients first exposure target cohort outcome date (time--event), classify ‘type’ timing outcome occurs ‘first exposure’ meaning outcome occurs patient observed target cohort, ‘first’ means outcome occurs first target cohort exposure, ‘eras’ means outcome occurs target exposures, ‘subsequent’ means outcome occurs non-first target exposure ‘last exposure’ means outcome occurs last exposure target cohort’s end date patient. outcome type classified whether outcome ‘first occurrence’ ‘subsequent occurrence’. Let’s consider patient 1, outcome twice. first outcome occurs 475 days first target exposure second outcome occurs 283 days first target exposure. second outcome patient 1 occurs subsequent target exposure era (first). Patient 2 outcome contribute time--event. Patient 3 first () outcome first exposure drug 44 days started drug first time. Patient 4 outcome twice, 92 days first exposure drug 354 days . first time outcome first exposure drug subsequent time outcome second exposure (subsequent exposure). Patient 5 outcome twice, 535 days first exposure drug 1064 days . first time outcome occurs drug exposure eras subsequent outcome occurs last exposure era. summarized Table 3. Table 3: Time--event intermediate summary. time--event output aggregates summary table three different perspectives: 1-day aggregate – calculates total number patients outcome time--event day grouped type outcome type. looks outcomes -100 days 100 days time--event. 30-day aggregate – calculates total number patients outcome 30-day sliding window time--event (e.g., 0-29, 30-59, 60-89, etc.) grouped type outcome type. looks outcomes -1095 days 1095 days time--event. 365-day aggregate – calculates total number patients outcome 365-day sliding window time--event (e.g., 0-365, 366-730, 731-1095, etc.) grouped type outcome type. looks outcomes -1095 days 1095 days time--event. summary results output time--event displayed Table 4. Table 4: Time--event output.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: vector targetIds, vector outcomeIds, integer dechallengeStopInterval integer dechallengeEvaluationWindow.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: summary data.frame number dechallenge rechallenge attempts per target outcome combination plus number dechallange/rechallenge attempts successes failures.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: dechallenge-rechallenge analysis finds often patient stops drug due occurrence outcome whether outcome stops, looks whether people re-exposed outcome start . observational data infer situations finding cases patient outcome recorded drug exposure seems stop drug within <dechallenge stop interval days – default 30 days> outcome occurs. patients dechallenge, determine whether success (outcome stops) failure (outcome continues). determined seeing whether outcome starts within <decallenge evaluation window days – default 30 days> exposure ends (outcome starting dechallenge failure otherwise success). patients dechallenge, look whether another exposure (decallenge evaluation window days first exposure end), rechallenge classed failure (outcome start rechallenge exposure era) success (outcome occur rechallenge exposure era).

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: consider inputs :
code: targetIds <- c(1) outcomeIds <- c(2)  dechallengeStopInterval <- 30 dechallengeEvaluationWindow <- 31

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: Example dechallenge-rechallenge data dates. Example time--event data timing. Let’s consider ten patients Table 5 Table 6 30 days dechallenge stop interval 31 days decallenge evaluation window. First, find cases outcome occurs exposure era exposure ends within 30 days outcome start. dechallenges. investigate whether new outcome starts within 31 days exposure era ending. failed dechallenges, otherwise dechallenge success. Next, dechallenges, find drug exposures occur 31 days dechallenge exposure era end. rechallaneges. rechallenge, determine whether outcome starts within 31 days rechallenge exposure era start. outcome occurs, rechallenge success, otherwise failure.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: Dehcallenge-rechallenge summary table showing dechallenge. patients dechallenge rechallenge.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: summarize results saying 4 dechallenges, 3 success 1 fail. 2 patients rechallenges 1 fail 1 success, see Table 8 example output one target outcome. Dehcallenge-rechallenge output. Note: way outcome exposure phenotype designed can make impossible unlikely see dechallenge fail. example, outcome designed 365 day washout window, means another outcome occurring within 365 days another outcome. dechallange failure outcome occurring within dechallenge evaluation window days exposure ends (exposure must end within stop interval days outcome dechallenge), using defaults values means dechallenge failure requires outcome possible within 60 days dechallenge outcome, impossible 365 washout window.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: vector targetIds plus minimum prior observation required target cohorts specifying features extract (covariateSettings).

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: target cohort restricted patients minimum prior observation index first occurrence mean value feature interest extracted data.frame.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: aggregate covariates calculates mean value feature within cohort patients. analysis restrict first occurrence cohort minimum prior observation days specified user (default 365 days). restriction implemented otherwise patient contribute multiple times mean value makes interpretation difficult.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: consider inputs :
code: minPriorObservation <- 365 covariateSettings <- FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings(   useDemographicsAge = T,    useDemographicsGender = T,   useConditionOccurrenceAnyTimePrior = T, includedCovariateConceptIds = c(201820)   )

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: Let’s assumed two two cohorts (id 1 2) first cohort contains five patients >365 days prior observation index second contains three patients >365 days prior observation index. patients features’ displayed Table 7, containing patients’ age index, whether diabetes anytime prior index sex features. Example patient level feature data.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: calculate mean values feature per cohort: Example aggregate features two example cohorts. database cohort comparison implements aggregate covariate analysis target outcome ids fed characterization across OMOP CDM databases available lets users compare mean values features databases cohort across different cohorts within database. standardized mean different calculated two cohorts possible, calculated per feature : abs(mean value cohort 1 - mean value cohort 2)/((standard deviation values cohort 1 squared plus standard deviation values cohort 2 squared)/2).

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: vector targetIds outcomeIds plus minimum prior observation required target cohorts, outcome washout days outcomes, settings time--risk covariate settings specifying features extract.

text: target outcome combination run aggregate covariate analysis special case comparing patients cohort 1 (patients target cohort first time 365 days prior observation go first occurrence outcome washout days time--risk relative target cohort index) vs cohort 2 (patients target cohort first time 365 days prior observation go first occurrence outcome washout days time--risk relative target cohort index).

text: Lets consider example time--risk target cohort start + 1 target cohort start + 180.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: First, find first target 365 days prior obs. Patient 1 removed exposed first time less 365 days prior observation. Patients 4 5 non-first exposures removed. leaves: Example target cohort meeting risk factor inclusion criteria. find patients target cohort outcome -outcome occurring 1 day 180 days index: Example target cohort meeting risk factor inclusion criteria. Note: also remove patients target outcome outcome washout days prior target index. example, nobody outcome prior, observed. features four patients : Example patient level feature data.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: calculate mean values feature per non-outcome outcome cohort: Example aggregate features risk factor analysis. can implement standardized mean different calculated outcome non-outcome cohorts, calculated per feature : abs(mean value outcome cohort - mean value non-outcome cohort)/((standard deviation values outcome cohort squared plus standard deviation values non-outcome cohort squared)/2).

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: cases series looks patients target cohort outcome specified time--risk calculates aggregate covariates three different time periods: shortly index, target index outcome index shortly outcome index.

text: vector targetIds outcomeIds plus minimum prior observation required target cohorts, outcome washout days outcomes, settings time--risk covariate settings specifying features extract. addition need specify long target index extract index features (preTargetIndexDays) long outcome index extract index features (postOutcomeIndexDays).

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: target outcome combination run aggregate covariate analysis patients target patients (minimum prior observation day index) outcome (first time outcome washout days). use three different time periods feature extraction: () preTargetIndexDays target index target index () target index plus 1 day outcome index () 1 day outcome index outcome index plus postOutcomeIndexDays

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: First, find first target 365 days prior obs. Patient 1 removed exposed first time less 365 days prior observation. Patients 4 5 non-first exposures removed. leaves: Example target cohort meeting risk factor inclusion criteria. find patients target cohort outcome occurring 1 day 180 days index: Example target cohort meeting case inclusion criteria. Note: also remove patients target outcome outcome washout days prior target index. example, nobody outcome prior, observed. Now define ( 365 days target index target index), (target index plus 1 outcome) (outcome index plus 1 outcome index plus 365): Example cases //dates. features two patients three time periods : Example patient level case feature data.

title: Characterization Package Specification
text: Finally, aggregate time periods: Example patient level case feature data.

title: Using Characterization Package
text: vignette describes can use Characterization package various descriptive studies using OMOP CDM data. Characterization package currently contains three different types analyses: Aggregate Covariates: returns mean feature value set features specified user ) Target cohort population, ii) Outcome cohort population, iii) Target population patients outcome user specified time--risk iv) Target population patients outcome user specified time--risk. DechallengeRechallenge: mainly aimed investigating whether drug event causally related seeing whether drug stopped close time event occurrence (dechallenge) whether drug restarted (rechallenge occurs) , whether event starts (failed rechallenge). analysis, Target cohorts drug users interest Outcome cohorts medical events wish see whether drug may cause. user must also specify close time drug must stopped outcome considered dechallenge close time Outcome must occur restarting drug considered failed rechallenge). Time--event: returns descriptive results showing timing target cohort outcome. can help identify whether outcome often precedes target cohort whether generally comes .

title: Using Characterization Package
text: First need install Characterization package: load : vignette show working examples using sample Eunomia R package GI Bleed simulated data. function exampleOmopConnectionDetails creates connection details object SQLITE database containing example observational medical outcomes partnership (OMOP) common data model (CDM) data temporary location.
code: remotes::install_github("ohdsi/Characterization") library(Characterization) library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union connectionDetails <- Characterization::exampleOmopConnectionDetails()

title: Using Characterization Package
text: run ‘Aggregate Covariate’ analysis need create setting object using createAggregateCovariateSettings. requires specifying: one targetIds (must pre-generated cohort table) one outcomeIds (must pre-generated cohort table) covariate settings using FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings creating custom feature extraction code. time--risk settings riskWindowStart startAnchor riskWindowEnd endAnchor Using Eunomia data previous generated four cohorts, can use cohort ids 1,2 4 targetIds cohort id 3 outcomeIds: want get information sex, age index Charlson Comorbidity index can create settings using FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings: additional covariate setting require calculated cases (patients target cohort outcome time--risk). called caseCovariateSettings created using createDuringCovariateSettings function. user can pick conditions, drugs, measurements, procedures observations. example, just include condition eras groups vocabulary heirarchy. also need specify two related variables casePreTargetDuration number days target index extract features cases (answers happens shortly target index) casePostOutcomeDuration number days outcome date extract features cases (answers happens outcome). case covariates also extracted target index outcome (answers question happens target exposure). want create aggregate features target cohorts, outcome cohort target cohort restricted record outcome 1 day target cohort start date 365 days target cohort end date outcome washout 9999 (meaning include outcomes first occurrence past 9999 days) include targets outcomes patient observed 365 days prior, can run: Next need use exampleAggregateCovariateSettings settings computeAggregateCovariateAnalyses, need use Eunomia connectionDetails Eunomia OMOP CDM data cohort table ‘main’ schema. cohort table name ‘cohort’. following code apply aggregated covariates analysis using previously specified settings simulated Eunomia data, can specify minCharacterizationMean exclude covarites mean values 0.01, must specify outputFolder csv results written . can see results location file.path(tempdir(), 'example_char', 'results') find csv files.
code: exampleTargetIds <- c(1, 2, 4) exampleOutcomeIds <- 3 exampleCovariateSettings <- FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings(   useDemographicsGender = T,   useDemographicsAge = T,   useCharlsonIndex = T ) caseCovariateSettings <- Characterization::createDuringCovariateSettings(   useConditionGroupEraDuring = T ) exampleAggregateCovariateSettings <- createAggregateCovariateSettings(   targetIds = exampleTargetIds,   outcomeIds = exampleOutcomeIds,   riskWindowStart = 1, startAnchor = "cohort start",   riskWindowEnd = 365, endAnchor = "cohort start",   outcomeWashoutDays = 9999,   minPriorObservation = 365,   covariateSettings = exampleCovariateSettings,   caseCovariateSettings = caseCovariateSettings,   casePreTargetDuration = 90,   casePostOutcomeDuration = 90 ) runCharacterizationAnalyses(   connectionDetails = connectionDetails,   cdmDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetTable = "cohort",   outcomeDatabaseSchema = "main",   outcomeTable = "cohort",   characterizationSettings = createCharacterizationSettings(     aggregateCovariateSettings = exampleAggregateCovariateSettings   ),   databaseId = "Eunomia",   runId = 1,   minCharacterizationMean = 0.01,   outputDirectory = file.path(tempdir(), "example_char", "results"),    executionPath = file.path(tempdir(), "example_char", "execution"),   minCellCount = 10,   incremental = F,   threads = 1 )

title: Using Characterization Package
text: run ‘Dechallenge Rechallenge’ analysis need create setting object using createDechallengeRechallengeSettings. requires specifying: one targetIds (must pre-generated cohort table) one outcomeIds (must pre-generated cohort table) dechallengeStopInterval dechallengeEvaluationWindow Using Eunomia data previous generated four cohorts, can use cohort ids 1,2 4 targetIds cohort id 3 outcomeIds: want create dechallenge rechallenge target cohorts outcome cohort 30 day dechallengeStopInterval 31 day dechallengeEvaluationWindow: can run analysis Eunomia data using computeDechallengeRechallengeAnalyses settings previously specified, minCellCount removing values less specified value: Next possible compute failed rechallenge cases
code: exampleTargetIds <- c(1, 2, 4) exampleOutcomeIds <- 3 exampleDechallengeRechallengeSettings <- createDechallengeRechallengeSettings(   targetIds = exampleTargetIds,   outcomeIds = exampleOutcomeIds,   dechallengeStopInterval = 30,   dechallengeEvaluationWindow = 31 ) dc <- computeDechallengeRechallengeAnalyses(   connectionDetails = connectionDetails,   targetDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetTable = "cohort",   settings = exampleDechallengeRechallengeSettings,   databaseId = "Eunomia",   outcomeFolder = file.path(tempdir(), "example_char", "results"),   minCellCount = 5 ) failed <- computeRechallengeFailCaseSeriesAnalyses(   connectionDetails = connectionDetails,   targetDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetTable = "cohort",   settings = exampleDechallengeRechallengeSettings,   outcomeDatabaseSchema = "main",   outcomeTable = "cohort",   databaseId = "Eunomia",   outcomeFolder = file.path(tempdir(), "example_char", "results"),   minCellCount = 5 )

title: Using Characterization Package
text: run ‘Time--event’ analysis need create setting object using createTimeToEventSettings. requires specifying: one targetIds (must pre-generated cohort table) one outcomeIds (must pre-generated cohort table) can run analysis Eunomia data using computeTimeToEventAnalyses settings previously specified:
code: exampleTimeToEventSettings <- createTimeToEventSettings(   targetIds = exampleTargetIds,   outcomeIds = exampleOutcomeIds ) tte <- computeTimeToEventAnalyses(   connectionDetails = connectionDetails,   cdmDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetTable = "cohort",   settings = exampleTimeToEventSettings,   databaseId = "Eunomia",   outcomefolder = file.path(tempdir(), "example_char", "results"),   minCellCount = 5 )

title: Using Characterization Package
text: want run multiple analyses (three previously shown) can use createCharacterizationSettings. need input list settings (NULL want run one type analysis). run analyses previously shown one function: create csv files results saveDirectory. can run following code view results shiny app:
code: characterizationSettings <- createCharacterizationSettings(   timeToEventSettings = list(     exampleTimeToEventSettings   ),   dechallengeRechallengeSettings = list(     exampleDechallengeRechallengeSettings   ),   aggregateCovariateSettings = exampleAggregateCovariateSettings )  # save the settings using saveCharacterizationSettings(   settings = characterizationSettings,   saveDirectory = file.path(tempdir(), "saveSettings") )  # the settings can be loaded characterizationSettings <- loadCharacterizationSettings(   saveDirectory = file.path(tempdir(), "saveSettings") )  runCharacterizationAnalyses(   connectionDetails = connectionDetails,   cdmDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetDatabaseSchema = "main",   targetTable = "cohort",   outcomeDatabaseSchema = "main",   outcomeTable = "cohort",   characterizationSettings = characterizationSettings,   outputDirectory = file.path(tempdir(), "example", "results"),   executionPath = file.path(tempdir(), "example", "execution"),   csvFilePrefix = "c_",   databaseId = "1",   incremental = F,   minCharacterizationMean = 0.01,   minCellCount = 5 ) viewCharacterization(   resultFolder = file.path(tempdir(), "example", "results"),   cohortDefinitionSet = NULL )

title: Implement Descriptive Studies Using the Common Data Model
code: library(Characterization)  connectionDetails <- Characterization::exampleOmopConnectionDetails()  targetIds <- c(1,2,4)   outcomeIds <- c(3)    timeToEventSettings1 <- createTimeToEventSettings(     targetIds = 1,     outcomeIds = c(3,4)   )   timeToEventSettings2 <- createTimeToEventSettings(     targetIds = 2,     outcomeIds = c(3,4)   )    dechallengeRechallengeSettings <- createDechallengeRechallengeSettings(     targetIds = targetIds,     outcomeIds = outcomeIds,     dechallengeStopInterval = 30,     dechallengeEvaluationWindow = 31   )    aggregateCovariateSettings1 <- createAggregateCovariateSettings(     targetIds = targetIds,     outcomeIds = outcomeIds,     riskWindowStart = 1,     startAnchor = 'cohort start',     riskWindowEnd = 365,     endAnchor = 'cohort start',     covariateSettings = FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings(       useDemographicsGender = T,       useDemographicsAge = T,       useDemographicsRace = T     )   )    aggregateCovariateSettings2 <- createAggregateCovariateSettings(     targetIds = targetIds,     outcomeIds = outcomeIds,     riskWindowStart = 1,     startAnchor = 'cohort start',     riskWindowEnd = 365,     endAnchor = 'cohort start',     covariateSettings = FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings(       useConditionOccurrenceLongTerm = T     )   )    characterizationSettings <- createCharacterizationSettings(     timeToEventSettings = list(       timeToEventSettings1,       timeToEventSettings2       ),     dechallengeRechallengeSettings = list(       dechallengeRechallengeSettings     ),     aggregateCovariateSettings = list(       aggregateCovariateSettings1,       aggregateCovariateSettings2       )   )    runCharacterizationAnalyses(   connectionDetails = connectionDetails,   cdmDatabaseSchema = 'main',   targetDatabaseSchema = 'main',   targetTable = 'cohort',   outcomeDatabaseSchema = 'main',   outcomeTable = 'cohort',   characterizationSettings = characterizationSettings,      outputDirectory = file.path(tempdir(), 'example', 'results'),   executionPath = file.path(tempdir(), 'example', 'execution'),   csvFilePrefix = 'c_',   databaseId = 'Eunomia' )

title: Compute dechallenge rechallenge study — computeDechallengeRechallengeAnalyses
text: connectionDetails object type `connectionDetails` created using [DatabaseConnector::createConnectionDetails()] function. targetDatabaseSchema Schema name target cohort table resides. Note SQL Server, include database schema name, example 'scratch.dbo'. targetTable Name target cohort table. outcomeDatabaseSchema Schema name outcome cohort table resides. Note SQL Server, include database schema name, example 'scratch.dbo'. outcomeTable Name outcome cohort table. tempEmulationSchema database platforms like Oracle Impala truly support temp tables. emulate temp tables, provide schema write privileges temp tables can created settings settings timeToEvent study databaseId identifier database (string) outputFolder directory save results csv files minCellCount minimum cell value display, values less replaced -1 ... extra inputs

code: conDet <- exampleOmopConnectionDetails()  drSet <- createDechallengeRechallengeSettings(   targetIds = c(1,2),   outcomeIds = 3 )  computeDechallengeRechallengeAnalyses(   connectionDetails = conDet,   targetDatabaseSchema = 'main',   targetTable = 'cohort',   settings = drSet,   outputFolder = tempdir() ) #> Inputs checked #> Connecting using SQLite driver #> Computing dechallenge rechallenge results #> Executing SQL took 0.0197 secs #> Computing dechallenge rechallenge for 2 target ids and 1 outcome ids took 0.356 secs #> exporting to csv file #> Writing 0 rows to csv

code: # example code  conDet <- exampleOmopConnectionDetails()  tteSet <- createTimeToEventSettings(   targetIds = c(1,2),   outcomeIds = 3 )  result <- computeTimeToEventAnalyses(   connectionDetails = conDet,   targetDatabaseSchema = 'main',   targetTable = 'cohort',   cdmDatabaseSchema = 'main',   settings = tteSet,   outputFolder = file.path(tempdir(), 'tte') ) #> Connecting using SQLite driver #> Uploading #cohort_settings #> Inserting data took 0.0153 secs #> Computing time to event results #> Executing SQL took 0.0302 secs #> Computing time-to-event for 2 T-O pairs took 0.222 secs #> exporting to csv file #> Writing 96 rows to csv

code: createAggregateCovariateSettings(   targetIds,   outcomeIds,   minPriorObservation = 0,   outcomeWashoutDays = 0,   riskWindowStart = 1,   startAnchor = "cohort start",   riskWindowEnd = 365,   endAnchor = "cohort start",   covariateSettings = FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings(useDemographicsGender =     TRUE, useDemographicsAge = TRUE, useDemographicsAgeGroup = TRUE, useDemographicsRace     = TRUE, useDemographicsEthnicity = TRUE, useDemographicsIndexYear = TRUE,     useDemographicsIndexMonth = TRUE, useDemographicsTimeInCohort = TRUE,     useDemographicsPriorObservationTime = TRUE, useDemographicsPostObservationTime =     TRUE, useConditionGroupEraLongTerm = TRUE, useDrugGroupEraOverlapping = TRUE,     useDrugGroupEraLongTerm = TRUE, useProcedureOccurrenceLongTerm = TRUE,           useMeasurementLongTerm = TRUE, useObservationLongTerm = TRUE,     useDeviceExposureLongTerm = TRUE, useVisitConceptCountLongTerm = TRUE,     useConditionGroupEraShortTerm = TRUE, useDrugGroupEraShortTerm = TRUE,     useProcedureOccurrenceShortTerm = TRUE, useMeasurementShortTerm = TRUE,     useObservationShortTerm = TRUE, useDeviceExposureShortTerm = TRUE,     useVisitConceptCountShortTerm = TRUE, endDays = 0, longTermStartDays = -365,     shortTermStartDays = -30),   caseCovariateSettings = createDuringCovariateSettings(useConditionGroupEraDuring =     TRUE, useDrugGroupEraDuring = TRUE, useProcedureOccurrenceDuring = TRUE,     useDeviceExposureDuring = TRUE, useMeasurementDuring = TRUE, useObservationDuring =     TRUE, useVisitConceptCountDuring = TRUE),   casePreTargetDuration = 365,   casePostOutcomeDuration = 365,   extractNonCaseCovariates = TRUE )

title: Create aggregate covariate study settings — createAggregateCovariateSettings
text: targetIds list cohortIds target cohorts outcomeIds list cohortIds outcome cohorts minPriorObservation minimum time (days) database patient target cohorts must observed prior index outcomeWashoutDays Patients outcome within outcomeWashout days prior index excluded risk factor analysis riskWindowStart start risk window (days) relative `startAnchor`. startAnchor anchor point start risk window. Can `"cohort start"` `"cohort end"`. riskWindowEnd end risk window (days) relative `endAnchor`. endAnchor anchor point end risk window. Can `"cohort start"` `"cohort end"`. covariateSettings object created using FeatureExtraction::createCovariateSettings caseCovariateSettings object created using createDuringCovariateSettings casePreTargetDuration number days prior case index use FeatureExtraction casePostOutcomeDuration number days prior case index use FeatureExtraction extractNonCaseCovariates Whether extract aggregate covariates counts patients targets outcomes addition cases

title: Create during covariate settings — createDuringCovariateSettings

title: Create during covariate settings — createDuringCovariateSettings
text: useConditionOccurrenceDuring One covariate per condition condition_occurrence table starting cohort start cohort end. (analysis ID 109) useConditionOccurrencePrimaryInpatientDuring One covariate per condition observed primary diagnosis inpatient setting condition_occurrence table starting cohort start cohort end. (analysis ID 110) useConditionEraDuring One covariate per condition condition_era table starting cohort start cohort end. (analysis ID 217) useConditionGroupEraDuring One covariate per condition era rolled groups condition_era table starting cohort start cohort end. (analysis ID 218) useDrugExposureDuring One covariate per drug drug_exposure table cohort start end. (analysisId 305) useDrugEraDuring One covariate per drug drug_era table cohort start end. (analysis ID 417) useDrugGroupEraDuring One covariate per drug rolled ATC groups drug_era table cohort start end. (analysis ID 418) useProcedureOccurrenceDuring One covariate per procedure procedure_occurrence table cohort start end. (analysis ID 505) useDeviceExposureDuring One covariate per device device exposure table starting cohort start end. (analysis ID 605) useMeasurementDuring One covariate per measurement measurement table cohort start end. (analysis ID 713) useObservationDuring One covariate per observation observation table cohort start end. (analysis ID 805) useVisitCountDuring number visits observed cohort start end. (analysis ID 926) useVisitConceptCountDuring number visits observed cohort start end, stratified visit concept ID. (analysis ID 927) includedCovariateConceptIds list concept IDs used construct covariates. addDescendantsToInclude descendant concept IDs added list concepts include? excludedCovariateConceptIds list concept IDs used construct covariates. addDescendantsToExclude descendant concept IDs added list concepts exclude? includedCovariateIds list covariate IDs restricted .

title: execute a large-scale characterization study — runCharacterizationAnalyses
code: runCharacterizationAnalyses(   connectionDetails,   targetDatabaseSchema,   targetTable,   outcomeDatabaseSchema,   outcomeTable,   tempEmulationSchema = getOption("sqlRenderTempEmulationSchema"),   cdmDatabaseSchema,   characterizationSettings,   outputDirectory,   executionPath = file.path(outputDirectory, "execution"),   csvFilePrefix = "c_",   databaseId = "1",   showSubjectId = FALSE,   minCellCount = 0,   incremental = TRUE,   threads = 1,   minCharacterizationMean = 0.01 )

title: execute a large-scale characterization study — runCharacterizationAnalyses
text: connectionDetails connection details database containing OMOP CDM data targetDatabaseSchema Schema name target cohort table resides. Note SQL Server, include database schema name, example 'scratch.dbo'. targetTable Name target cohort table. outcomeDatabaseSchema Schema name outcome cohort table resides. Note SQL Server, include database schema name, example 'scratch.dbo'. outcomeTable Name outcome cohort table. tempEmulationSchema database platforms like Oracle Impala truly support temp tables. emulate temp tables, provide schema write privileges temp tables can created cdmDatabaseSchema schema OMOP CDM data characterizationSettings study settings created using createCharacterizationSettings outputDirectory location save final csv files executionPath location intermediate results saved csvFilePrefix string append csv files outputDirectory databaseId unique identifier cdm database showSubjectId Whether include subjectId failed rechallenge case series hide minCellCount minimum count value calculated incremental TRUE skip previously executed analyses completed threads number threads use running aggregate covariates minCharacterizationMean minimum mean threshold extract running aggregate covariates

title: Characterization 2.1.4
text: fixed csv spec: made mean_exposure_time float specified min_characterization_mean covariate table must non-null pk. added migration SQL change mean_exposure_time float changed Line 284 AggregateCovariates.R cast exposure_time summary values bigint due integer overflow dbms. added dummy sql code prevent warnings missing variables added code save empty csv files rows way easier see results vs error saving. removed progress bar custom features added option includedFiles insertResultsToDatabase() can specify csv files upload prevent warnings missing csv files. made sure connections disconnected use
